of diluted TCEP to the concentrated antibody in the 50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device
Mix antibody and TCEP solution by flicking the 50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device gently

Incubate at
for
ONLY
Do not incubate longer than 30 min, this will result in full reduction of disulfide bonds necessary for the structural integrity of the antibody

After incubation, add immediately
of buffer 3 to the partially reduced antibody in the50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device
Mix reduced antibody and wash buffer 3 (Tris buffed salt, 1 mM EDTA, pH 7.5) by flicking the 50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device gently

of buffer 3

of buffer 3
Transfer the preloaded polymer solution in the reduced antibody/ 50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device
Mix reduced antibody and preloaded polymer by flicking the 50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device gently

to
Add 250 µL of buffer 4 to the antibody conjugation mixture in the the 50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device

Make sure to align the filters parallel to centrifuge force to ensure optimal tengential flow filtration of both filters
This can be done by centering the hinge of the collecting tube between the two filters
The 50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device is then placed in the centrifuge with the hinge outward
Mix antibody conjugation mixture and buffer 4 (Tris buffed salt, pH 7.5) by flicking the 50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device gently
or
Discard the flow through

of buffer 4 in the the 50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device

Invert the micro-filter into a new collection tube

Add
of buffer 4 to the washed labelled antibody in the the 50-kDa MWCO micro-filter device
to 33
Measure the volume retrieved with a pipette (200 µL) and register data in labelled volume on the worksheet
Open Nanodrop using Protein 280 and chose type = IgG
Blank with buffer 4

Take
of labelled antibody and measure concentration
Clean the cell with ultrapure (type 1) water
Register data in labelled volume on the worksheet
Open MIBItracker and click on CONJUGATES tab
Click on Add Conjugate tab

Select the antibody reference used for the conjugation
Fill the following fields: Isotope/ Channel; Element; µg for labelling; Responsible

Click on SUBMIT, this will generate a conjugation ID number
Click on back to Conjugate and filter by conjugation date
Record the ID number on your experiment worksheet
Click on Edit Conjugate
Enter Nanodrop reading post-labelling and Volume of labeled antibody in the respective fields

For a standard labeled stock concentration (200 µg/mL), the Dilution factor and the volume of Antibody Stabilizer is calculated automatically
If the Dilution factor is less than <1, change labeled stock concentration to 100 µg/mL
Add the volume of Antibody Stabilizer to the antibody labeled collection tube. Use Tris-based antibody stabilizer (Boca Scientific).
Transfer the diluted labeled antibody into a new screw cap microcentrifuge tube

Label the tube with printer Brady 21-Lab, (Label for 1.5 mL vial, Auto bold)
Line1: Target name, Channel
Line2: ID: number
Line3: date (mm/dd/yy)
Hand write the target name and the channel on a dot label and place on the screw cap

source.title: Short term storage at 4˚C/ Long term storage Lyophilized

source.description:
Labeled can be stored short term for <3 months at 4˚C in solution
Preferably, the newly labeled labeled antibody is immediately placed in the lyophilization box at 4˚C
in queue to be lyophilized and then placed at 4˚C in designated box for longterm storage management

materials.name: Centrifugal Filter Unit: 50 kDa Amicon Ultra 500 μL V bottom

description: This is a "protocol IO" extended version of MIBItag conjugation kit protocol from Ionpath.
